intro: Valeriana carnosa, commonly known as the showy valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features a robust root system and upright stems that can grow up to 2 to 3 feet tall. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Valeriana carnosa is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
